meanings.sent1: The rubber band kept recoiling after being stretched.
meanings.sent2: The spring recoiled when released from pressure.
meanings.sent3: The cat was recoiling playfully from the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His mind recoiled at the thought of failure.
meanings.sent5: The memories recoiled in his mind, vivid and haunting.

meanings.definition: To shrink back, as in fear or repugnance.
meanings.sent1: She recoiled in horror at the sight of the spider.
meanings.sent2: The child recoiled from the loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs made him recoil in mock disgust.
meanings.sent4: Her heart recoiled at the cruel words spoken.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the forest made her instincts recoil in fear.

meanings.sent1: The turtle recoiled into its shell for protection.
meanings.sent2: The flower recoiled from the harsh sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The fabric recoiled slightly when washed in hot water.
meanings.sent4: His confidence recoiled after the harsh criticism.
meanings.sent5: The cat recoiled from the water, trying to stay dry.
